title: Nigeria: Osibanjo Tasks State Economic Planners, NPC On Strategic Planning
text:
Cote d'Ivoire: Nation Votes in First Post-War Presidential Poll By Emmanuel Elebeke Vice President, Professor Yemi Osinbajo has enjoins Commissioners of Economic Planning at the State level to work closely with the National Planning Commission in order to address developmental challenges in their States. The Vice President made the call at the ongoing meeting of the National Council on Development Planning (NCDP) held in Awka, Anambra State. Professor Osinbajo who was represented at the meeting by the Secretary to the National Planning Commission, Bassey Akpanyung, stressed the need for closer collaboration between federal and state economic planners for greater development in the country. "The Challenges necessitate our collective resolve to bring about the desired change in our country for the good of all. I therefore enjoin the Commissioners of Economic Planning at the State level to work closely with the National Planning Commission and other key economic managers at the national level in addressing the situation," he said. The membership of the NCDP consists of Honourable Commissioners and Chief Executives of Agencies responsible for development planning in the 36 States of the Federation and FCT. The Council meets bi-annually and the recommendations arising therefrom are forwarded to the National Economic Council under the Chairmanship of the Vice President for consideration. Commenting on the theme of the Conference: "Achieving Positive Change for Inclusive Growth and Sustainable Development: The Role of Strategic Planning", the Vice President stated, "This is consistent with the aspirations of the Change Agenda of the current Administration at the national level, working closely with the State Governments, through the instrumentality of the National Economic Council under my chairmanship" Highlighting the significance of the NCDP, the NPC scribe, Bassey Akpanyung, who was represented by the Director (macro), Tunde Lawal, said that, the Council meetings have, over the years, been most productive in terms of the quality of the outcomes and recommendations that emerged which subsequently translated into Government policies at the Federal and sub-national levels The Anambra State Governor, Willie Obiano, represented by the Deputy Governor, Dr Nkem Okeke, stated that, the theme of the conference resonates perfectly with the strategic approach to governance in Anambra State.
